items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Natural Gas Spot Prices Slide as Production, LNG Rebound
items.summary: Physical natural gas price movements varied by region but declined overall Thursday as U.S. production and LNG feed gas demand recovered in the wake of Winter Storm Fern.

items.title: AccuWeather Sees Northern Chills, Strong Demand for Natural Gas Extending Into Spring
items.summary: Natural gas demand to power furnaces and combat chilly weather could stretch deep into the spring season this year, AccuWeather said in a preliminary outlook.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Mixed as Gulf, Southeast Tighten
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices were mixed into midday Thursday, with sharp declines in the Northeast and West Texas offsetting gains in portions of the East, Midcontinent and South Central regions.

items.title: Renewables Push Raises Questions for Mexico’s Natural Gas Demand Growth
items.summary: Mexico’s government under President Claudia Sheinbaum has set ambitious renewable energy targets that some suggest could cut into the nation’s growing natural gas demand.

items.title: Natural Gas Forward Prices Post Big Gains With More Upside Ahead as Winter’s Grip Remains Strong
items.summary: The forward curve climbed higher over the past week, again driven by huge shifts in the Northeast, where spot prices climbed well above $100/MMBtu as the region grappled with extreme winter weather like most of the country.

items.title: TotalEnergies Restarts Mozambique LNG Work, Adding to Global Supply Wave
items.summary: TotalEnergies SE and its partners have finally restarted work on the Mozambique LNG project, opening the potential for an even larger jump in global natural gas supply by the end of the decade.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Traders Trim Gains as Bullish EIA Storage Draw Fails to Spark Rally
items.summary: Natural gas futures traded sideways into midday Thursday after a bullish EIA storage withdrawal failed to ignite further upside, with traders still digesting the expired February contract’s early week fireworks.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Natural Gas Futures Traders Cautious Following Bullish Storage Withdrawal
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) reported a withdrawal of 242 Bcf natural gas from Lower 48 storage for the week ended Jan. 23. The result exceeded expectations but had little immediate impact on Nymex natural gas futures.

items.title: Woodside Reports Strong Construction Progress at 16.5 Mt/y Louisiana LNG Terminal
items.summary: Foundational work on Louisiana LNG’s first phase is advancing on schedule as commercialization continues, keeping the project on track for first LNG before the end of the decade, according to Woodside Energy Group Ltd.

items.title: StanChart: Bearish Oil Glut Narrative Fades as Brent Breaks $70
items.summary: Oil prices surged to their highest level in months in Wednesday's session after reports emerged that U.S. President Donald Trump is weighing targeted strikes on Iranian military positions as he pursues regime change. Brent crude for March delivery wa

items.title: Colombia Turns to LNG as Domestic Gas Runs Out
items.summary: Colombia’s natural gas market is entering a period of sustained pressure as domestic production declines, new supply remains years away, and dependence on imported LNG deepens. The depletion of mature onshore fields, the freeze on new exploration lic

items.title: China’s Crude Hoarding Is Propping Up Oil Prices
items.summary: China played a big role in supporting oil prices in 2025 as it accelerated crude stockpiling and absorbed part of the additional supply that producers put on the market. Despite the easing of the OPEC+ cuts, the large supply growth from the Americas,

items.title: Mexico’s Dos Bocas Refinery Starts Biting Into U.S. Fuel Exports
items.summary: For years, Mexico has been a major fuel buyer from the United States. Then the government built a new refinery that cost $20 billion, which was planned to boost the country’s energy independence. It seems it has finally started to do just that—and fu

items.title: America’s Power Bill Shock Is Just Getting Started
items.summary: As Americans brave a brutal cold snap, households are facing higher heating bills this summer.  According to a report released last week by the National Energy Assistance Directors Association (NEADA), heating prices are expected to rise by 9.2% in t

items.title: Producers Rush to Hedge amid Exploding Natural Gas Prices
items.summary: After the Henry Hub natural gas price for February doubled, oil-and-gas producers aggressively locked in hedges. Cold weather caused the largest one-week rally since at least 1990. Oil and gas producers leaned into the historic rally in Nymex Henry H
